reviews.text: My friend and I tried two plates. The beef scallion and the stir fried chicken with roast peanuts. They were both flavorful and soooo delicious. I would definitely come back and try the rest of the plates. Also they have a nice fish tank with red fishes.
Great place!!! The eggplant is soooo goood!

tldr: i don't suggest eating inside unless you have money to tip. good food though

review:
i was really hungry and low on money before stumbling across this place so i just got one of the cheapest meals they had. i got the szechuan styled pork and i really enjoyed it.
but at the end when i was paying, the guy (seems like owner) really wanted me to tip and said that everyone tips. i didn't have the money at all so i had to tell him that but the vibes got really awkward. i don't feel welcomed to come back without tip money.
this may be the most tasty food in the entire world  A+++
The food was delicious .  Service was good.

Came back multiple times and itâ€™s fabulous authentic Sichuan food. Itâ€™s hidden gem. We canâ€™t get enough of the braised fish fillet in Chinese green pepper. Absolute food heaven - would bring family and friends

Small restaurant with a cool door xD, Eat here if your a big fan of spicy food with the Tea Roasted Duck being the only real entree option (which is still good) to order apart from veggies. None of my party liked eating Tilapia and the server said we could opt to having Lapu-Lapu instead which was pretty cool. Good place to bring an older crowd of people if they want to experience an Asian experience in flushing

The only reason why Iâ€™m giving this place four stars and not five is because I spent the entire next day on the toilet. Most of the food was great. I just donâ€™t think I have the stomach for it at my age anymore.. we got a bunch of food. Our favorite was the spicy shrimp and steak. The final meal we shared was the vermicelli noodles in red sauce , a little too weird for me. The soup dumplings were good, but nothing special. And the house fried rice was also solid but again nothing stand out. The service was very very good , plenty of servers and they were standing by for us the whole time with good water service too; and when it came time to finish up, they did not rush us out in anyway. If I could add some noodles to the menu I would. I also would change the physical menu entirely. They gave our party of four dudes two iPads to share, and the menu was glitchy at best. It was disorganized ,parts of it didnâ€™t work and hard to find what you picked out to order when the waiter came. If I were to have one minute with the manager, I would say buy some regular menus or print paper ones every week and throw them away often. Or even do the barcode thing. Eating around this area of flushing weâ€™ve seen some of the grossest menus Iâ€™ve witnessed worldwide. Having a gross, malfunctioning iPad put in your hands has taken it to the next level. I also feel like my five-year-old nephew could have designed the menu better. Last thing and this goes to all the restaurants. Wipe and clean the light switches and door handle areas. PLEASE!

Very delicious and authentic sichuan food, especially the twice cooked pork belly!
Food was amazing, service was great!
Servers comped our drinks and helped us clueless Americans order. Best hospitality in flushing! ðŸ˜

Spicy, flavorful, and mouth-numbing! Everything was so good. I especially recommend the spicy fish soup and beef. Will definitely be coming back.

Used to be a decent spot for sichuan classics, but went recently and the food was lacking both flavor and spice. Also feels expensive for what it is.

One my regular spot! Love it!

We tried the mapo tofu, schichuan fried chicken and the shredded potato. The food was amazinggg and spiced to perfection. Portion sizes were huge and the servers were extremely attentive. I cannot recommend this place enough!!!ðŸ©·ðŸ©·

I had an amazing experience at this Velley 41 restaurant! The flavors were bold, authentic, and perfectly balanced with that signature numbing spice. The braised pork belly (hong shao rou) was tender, flavorful, and melted in my mouth, while the dry pot was loaded with fresh ingredients and packed with flavor. The staff were friendly and attentive, and the atmosphere felt cozy and welcoming. Definitely one of the best spots in town for real Sichuan foodâ€”Iâ€™ll be coming back for sure!
Everyone should try this cold noodles. It looks spicy but tastes delicious. Every dish is very classic and authentic

Delicious food and great service. Would highly recommend.
Very tasty food, authentic sichuan, quick to serve

Rating: 8.5/10
Date Last Visited: 8/24/2025
We ordered a large variety of dishes, including beef, braised pork, spicy chicken, sautÃ©ed cabbage, eggplant, and fried fish fillet. Every dish tasted very authentic and had just the right amount of spice and flavor. The standouts were the fried fish, braised pork, and cabbage, but all the dishes were great. This place is the perfect definition of authentic Chinese food in Flushing. I donâ€™t remember the individual prices of each item, but the total came out to be around $27/person for a group 6. Overall, I would recommend if you are a fan of Sichuan food.
New favorite Chinese restaurant in New York. This place is so good and so authentic!
Super yammy Sichuan food! Spicy and delicious

we came here for lunch before a game and it was amazingâ€¦ good potions, I definitely recommend sharing dishes, decent prices, the smoked duck is a must!   the crabmeat and pork dumplings hit the spot!

Really blown away.

The place is very nice.  Nicely decorated, and with more than enough seating, including for bigger parties.  Cleanly, sleek, and the music wasn't loud, which for me is a big plus.

The server was very nice and made the whole experience very seamless.  We were given iPads to see what things on the menu looked!

The food was spectacular.  Delicious, with generous portions and reasonable prices.  I would suggest getting a couple big things among yourselves and sharing, with each person having a bowl of rice.

Great spot -- here's to many more visits, hopefully!

I recently visited Ally 41 in Flushing and was thoroughly impressed! As someone looking for vegetarian options, I was delighted with their offerings. The Mapo Tofu (vegetarian version) had perfectly soft tofu with a wonderful balance of leeks and spicy chili oil.

Their string beans were exceptionally fresh and perfectly salted - not sour like I've experienced at other restaurants. The real standout was their handmade noodles with sweet peanut sauce - these thick, inconsistently shaped noodles were so chewy they were almost "dumpling-like" in texture. Each bite was a joy!

I appreciated the complimentary pickled vegetables that added just the right amount of acidity to balance the meal. The portions were generous, and the atmosphere was cozy with nice industrial elements like cement walls and metal accents.

The staff was courteous, and I found the digital menu with accurate pictures and translations very helpful. Even if you don't speak Chinese, ordering is a breeze. Simple dishes executed perfectly - that's what great Sichuan cuisine is all about! Will definitely be returning soon.

I had saved this place in my favorite forever and finally got a chance to visit after a Mets game. The dishes were delicious. I tried the Szechuan slices beef, the noodle with minced meat, and the tofu with pork, and all of them were fantastic. Clearly, my eyes were bigger than my stomach could handle because I couldnâ€™t finish half of it. I had to take them home, which Iâ€™m happy about for tomorrow. The food and service were both great. Highly recommend!

Really authentic Chinese/Szechuan food in flushing area. We ordered the chefâ€™s recommended dishes and everything was just amazing. Portion is large too even for appetizers. Weâ€™re definitely going back again to try more.

æ­£å®—çš„å››å·èœï¼Œå¾ˆåœ°é“ï¼Œå¼ºæŽ¨ç§æˆ¿æ»‹å‘³åœ†å­æ±¤å’Œæ‹›ç‰Œé»„ä¼žè‚ºç‰‡ï¼Œé±¼å¥½åƒï¼Œæ—¶ä»¤èœä¹Ÿå¥½åƒï¼Œæ‹›ç‰Œå°ç‚’é»„ç‰›è‚‰ä¹Ÿæ£’æ£’ï¼ŒæœåŠ¡æ€åº¦å¾ˆå¥½ï¼Œè€æ¿å››å·äººï¼Œå¯ä»¥è·Ÿæˆ‘è¯´å®¶ä¹¡è¯ï¼Œappreciateï¼

Finally got to eat here after years of wanting to. Eggplant was so so yummy. The fish perfectly crispy. The sour beef soup amazing. The eggs were a little overly salty and the fungus bland, but it was a good accompaniment to the rest of the dishes. Service was friendly. Love this place! Will definitely come back!

I've come here a few times and their food is consistently good. I order random things to try new foods and it's always good.

The service is nice and quick and the interior design has a cool Asian theme.

On weekdays when I came, it was almost empty. It's probably because it's on the outskirts of where you normally find restaurants in flushing.

I highly recommend this restaurant.

I was immediately impressed upon entering Alley 41 and noticing that it has been recommended by the Michelin Guide every year from 2019 to 2024â€”an impressive and consistent achievement. I also saw that the restaurant had been featured in The New York Times, which added to my excitement.

From the beginning, the service stood out. My server, Leon, politely asked whether I preferred a hot or cold drink instead of assuming I wanted hot tea, as is often the default in Chinese restaurants. This small but thoughtful detail showed real attentiveness.

I ordered the stir-fried seasonal vegetable and the sautÃ©ed shredded potato with spicy. I also had many specific dietary requests: less oil, less salt, no MSG, and no soy sauce. To my delight, the kitchen honored all of them perfectly. I was genuinely impressed by the communication and teamwork between the server and the chef.

As a vegan diner, I found the experience not only satisfying but comforting in how my needs were respected. I highly recommend Alley 41 to anyone seeking delicious, authentic food with exceptional serviceâ€”especially fellow vegans.

Delicious sichuan restaurant. Each dish was so tasty. Would recommend the spicy crispy fish, beef in sour soup, and eggplant. The egg leek and mushroom veggie dish was good too but not as good as everything else.

Every bite here was amazing, and I love sichuan food so I think this place is quite special. Itâ€™s also hard to find a good crispy spicy fish. Food came out super fast as well. Friendly service.

Absolutely incredible meal!!! The food was SO good and everything came out so quickly!! Service was incredible as well. Highly recommend the sautÃ©ed beef, the homemade noodles, and the string beans!! Will be back again !!

Alley 41 is hands-down one of the best Sichuan restaurants in Flushing!ðŸ”¥ Clean environment, fast service, and incredibly authentic flavors. We came with a big group and ordered a tonâ€”everything was delicious. Highlights: the Spicy Crab was bold and fragrant, Dry-Fried Frog perfect with rice, and the Black Pepper Beef on Iron Plate is a must. Also loved the Cold Noodles with Pork, Steamed Whole Fish, and the crispy Red Sugar Guokui for dessert ðŸ¥¹ Portions are generous, prices are fair, and the spice level hits just right. Perfect for group dinners or family gatherings. Highly recommend if youâ€™re craving legit Sichuan food in NYC!

The cold noodles with pork belly were so delicious, the sauce was amazing. The soup I got was a pretty good sized portion - suitable for sharing. The sautÃ©ed shrimp and leek was good!

Ps. .We sat next to the fish tank, and the fish were so welcoming ðŸ¥°.

Came here for lunch and left with a great experience under our belt. The food is AMAZING, the service was very friendly, and the restaurant itself is clean and inviting. Great for sharing plates and trying a little of everything. The tea smoked and duck and stir fried green beans were my absolute favorite, must try! The Dan Dan noodles and the soup dumplings were great as well. Will be back soon!

ðŸŒ¶ï¸ Outstanding Szechuan Experience! ðŸŒ¶ï¸
I had an incredible meal at this Szechuan restaurant! The flavors were bold, authentic, and perfectly balanced â€” exactly what youâ€™d hope for from real Szechuan cuisine. The mapo tofu was silky and spicy with just the right amount of numbing heat, and the dry-fried green beans were crispy and full of flavor.

Service was friendly and efficient, and the atmosphere was cozy yet lively â€” perfect for a casual dinner or a night out with friends. You can tell they care about quality and staying true to tradition.

Highly recommend if you love spicy food or want to try something new and delicious. Iâ€™ll definitely be coming back!

My wife and I had an absolutely delightful lunch at Alley41, and we canâ€™t stop raving about it! This Chinese restaurant is a hidden gem that delivers on every frontâ€”flavor, ambiance, and service. From the moment we walked in, the warm and inviting atmosphere made us feel right at home. The modern yet cozy decor set the perfect tone for a relaxing meal.
The menu was a treasure trove of authentic Chinese dishes, and everything we ordered was bursting with flavor. The service was impeccableâ€”our server was attentive, friendly, and offered great recommendations without being pushy.

Alley41 is now our go-to spot for Chinese cuisine, and weâ€™re already looking forward to our next visit.

Came here for family dinner, we order the spicy beef, tofu veg and noodles dish.  They were all so delicious.  The portion were huge and the drink prices are super affordable.  The balance of spice level with each ingredient is perfect.  Would def return next time.
They messed up order and made us pay for an extra dish. The portions are decent but in very large groups, >10, likely not enough for everyone. Fairly expensive, 37$ each.
The food is incredible, and the service is outstanding. I highly recommend giving this place a try â€” itâ€™s worth every penny. I also love the cozy, unsuspecting ambiance tucked away inside.

The food was delicious. We ordered Chicken Dumplings in Sichuan Sauce, Dan Dan Noodles with Stir Fried Pork and Stir Fried chicken with peanuts. It was really good, and relevant spicy. Not unnecessarily sweet and actual spicy, which I love.

I came by because my favorite restaurant, He Nan Mian Guan, was closed. I stumbled upon this place right next door and am so glad I did! Incredible ambiance and the food was delicious! I got the spicy boiled fish which literally rocked my world. The server was also super sweet and so patient when explaining the menu to me. Highly recommend coming here!!

The dishes looked great, the fish looked great, but the tasteâ€¦ not so much. It wasnâ€™t exactly bad, but it wasnâ€™t impressive either. I kind of doubt the kidney was fully cooked, the center still looked pretty red, which was a bit worrying. Plus, even a bowl of plain white rice costs $2, which makes the whole meal feel overpriced for the flavor I got

First off, I have had all kinds of duck in multiple cities and this tea smoked duck is by far the best Iâ€™ve ever had. The staff was attentive and made sure I had everything I needed. Iâ€™m by myself in NYC for a getaway and this spot was very quiet and relaxing. Come here. Itâ€™s amazing.
